New Records: Oklahoma City Thunder set a franchise record with its 14th-straight win of the season
Key Match Events: Aaron Wiggins' 19 points, five rebounds, and two blocks in the fourth quarter were crucial in the Thunder's comeback victory
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 33 points, four rebounds, and seven assists on 12-of-26 shooting
Post-Match Reflections: Isaiah Hartenstein praised Aaron Wiggins, saying 'we all knew how good of a player he is'
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander expressed confidence in Jalen Williams, saying 'he is an All-Star, whether he makes it or not'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder's second unit scored 44 points, a key factor in the eventual victory
The Thunder will face the Boston Celtics and Cleveland Cavaliers in upcoming challenging games
Others: Aaron Wiggins' mom's birthday coincided with his heroics in the game
